Description: Small sherd of wall of North Ionian pottery open vase, perhaps a chalice; cream slip; inside glazed; outside, part of a head of a lion to right and uncertain object.
Curator's comments: The glaze on the inside is of much better quality than is normal for Chios.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.122)
